name: Studio Daniele Tumietto
goal:
Italian accountancy profession (chartered accountant). Consultant on organization of private companies and public authorities on digital management of processes and documents.
Expert of UNINFO(*) and, for this reason, I’m collaborator in AGID (Italian Agency for the Digital Agenda) and I participate at various technical workgroups and workshops on eIDAS, e-invoicing, e-procurement, GDPR, cybersecurity, IoT and other activities.
I'm also a member of:
- United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) for the drafting of a White Paper on Blockchain and international trade;
- International Telecommunication Union (ITU), a specialized United Nations agency for information and communication technologies: Focus Group on Application of Distributed Ledger Technology (FG-DLT); Focus Group on Environmental Efficiency for Artificial Intelligence and other Emerging Technologies (FG-AI4EE); Focus Group on Quantum Information Technologies for Networks (FG-QIT4N)
- European Committee for Standardization (CEN) in the BT/WG220 Fintech and in the Focus Group on DLT and Blockchain, for the preparation of the launch of the European Forum on Blockchain;
- European Committee for Standardization TC434 for the development and implementation of the European standard for e-invoicing (Directive 2014/55/EU);
- Technical Committee European Committee for Standardization TC440 for the development of the European standard for public eProcurement;
- Expert Group at EMSFEI - CEN for the development of the European standard for the "Core Invoice" CEN/TC434 in application of Directive 2014/55 / ​​EU; Advisory Group at the Connecting Europe Facility - CEF for the development of the "Match-making Website" for Public Administrations.- - Italian Forum on Electronic Invoicing;
- Italian Forum on eProcurement;
- Italian Forum of Preservation;


(*) UNINFO is federated body of UNI (National Body of the standardization) on ICT matters at national and international level. It represents Italy at ISO, ISO/IEC JTC 1, CEN and European Commission. UNI is recognized by the European Union (article 27 Regulation (UE) n. 1025/2012).
interests: Business and Industry, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Fraud prevention, Taxation
euInitiatives: I work to write standardization rules on CT of national body UNINFO: UNI/CT510 "Signs, Label, identity, and trust services"; UNI/CT522 "eBusiness and financial services";  UNI/CT526 "standardization rules for professionals on security and privacy sector"; UNI/CT532  "Blockchain Distributed Ledger Technology".
